com.moniuliuma.android.decode.configuration

Class PropertyGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moniuliuma.android.decode.configuration.PropertyGroup
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GoodReadNotification, IntentWedge, KeyboardWedge, LaserOptions, ScannerProperties, SuffixFormatting, SymbologyBase, UpcEanExtensions

    public class PropertyGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    PropertyGroup contains properties and/or other property groups.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load(PropertyGetter from)
        Load the properties values contained by this property from the PropertyGetter.
        Parameters:
        from - is the PropertyGetter from which the properties values are loaded.

      • store

        public void store(PropertyEditor to,
                  boolean persist)
           throws ConfigException
        Store the properties values contained by this property into the PropertyEditor.
        Parameters:
        to - is the PropertyEditor to which the properties values are stored.
        persist - if true the configuration is saved in a persistent way across system reboot.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - On unsupported parameter index, the error_number is ID_ERROR. In case of many errors caught during the store() for the properties belonging to the group, the final error message includes all errors messages in a concatenated format and the final error_code is the OR of the single error codes. For the complete list of errors:
        See Also:
        ConfigException

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported()
        Tells if this property group is supported by the underling decoding hardware.
        Returns:
        true if at least one contained property is supported by the underling decoding hardware.
        If this property group doesn't contain any property, this method returns false.

      • getProperties

        public java.util.ArrayList<Property> getProperties()
        Returns the properties contained by this group.
        Returns:
        the properties in as ArrayList.
        It is null if there are no properties in this group.

      • getGroups

        public java.util.ArrayList<PropertyGroup> getGroups()
        Returns the property groups contained by this group.
        Returns:
        the property groups in as ArrayList.
        It is null if there are no other property groups in this group.
